DPR Ancam Tak Gelar Rapat Lagi dengan BPJS Kesehatan dan Kemenkes
06 Nov 2019, 12:09 by Francisca Christy Rosana, Kodrat Setiawan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Anggota Komisi IX DPR dari Fraksi Partai Kebangkitan Bangsa atau PKB, Nihayatul Wafiroh, mengeluhkan terbitnya Peraturan Presiden Nomor 75 Tahun 2019 tentang Jaminan Kesehatan. Beleid yang diteken Presiden Joko Widodo atau Jokowi ini mengesahkan rencana pemerintah menaikkan premi iuran BPJS Kesehatan di seluruh segmen peserta.
Nihayatul mengatakan terbitnya perpres tersebut menyeleweng dari hasil rapat dengar pendapat dengan legislatif. Sebelumnya, dalam rapat pada 2 September lalu, seluruh anggota Komisi IX sepakat meminta pemerintah tidak menaikkan premi BPJS Kesehatan khusus bagi peserta mandiri kelas III.
“Saya merasa Komisi IX ini sudah tidak ada harganya lagi. Hasil rapat September lalu, kami meminta pemerintah tidak menaikkan iuran untuk kelas III, tapi ternyata Perpres tetap terbit,” ujar Nihayatul di kompleks Senayan, Jakarta, Rabu, 6 November 2019.
Nihayatul mengatakan upaya pemerintah mengerek premi asuransi kesehatan, khususnya untuk kelas III, masih menuai perdebatan. Apalagi, sesuai dengan Perpres itu, besaran iuran di seluruh segmen naik 100 persen dari besaran semula.
Ia lalu mengancam komisinya tak bakal menggelar rapat lagi dengan BPJS Kesehatan dan Kementerian Kesehatan semisal pemerintah tidak mencabut Perpres. “Sepakat Bapak-bapak, Ibu-ibu?” tutur Nihayatul meminta kesepakatan anggota Komisi IX setelah melontarkan ancaman.
Pertanyaan itu dijawab serempak oleh anggota komisi. “Setuju,” ujar mayoritas anggota Dewan. Meski demikian, pimpinan sidang belum mengetok permintaan anggota sidang lantaran kewenangan mengesahkan kenaikan iuran berada di tangan Presiden Jokowi.
Hingga berita ini ditulis, rapat dengar pendapat masih berlangsung. Kementerian Kesehatan dan BPJS Kesehatan belum memberikan tanggapan terkait pernyataan anggota Komisi IX DPR.
Berdasarkan catatan Tempo, pada rapat 2 September lalu, DPR meminta pemerintah lebih dulu membenahi data peserta iuran jaminan kesehatan melalui data cleansing sebelum menaikkan premi. Sebab, DPR mensinyalir banyak masyarakat miskin yang masih membayar premi secara mandiri.
Sebaliknya, tidak semua peserta penerima bantuan iuran merupakan masyarakat miskin. DPR juga meminta pemerintah membenahi data penerima bantuan JKN sesuai dengan hasil audit dari Badan Pengawasan Keuangan dan Pembangunan tahun 2018. Saat itu tercatat masih ada 10.654.539 peserta JKN yang bermasalah
Di sisi lain, Kementerian Sosial mencatat telah menon-aktifkan 5 juta peserta penerima bantuan JKN sepanjang Agustus yang tidak terdaftar dalam data terpadu. Sebanyak 5 juta penerima bantuan itu memiliki nomor induk kependudukan yang valid dan terhitung tidak pernah mengakses fasilitas kesehatan.

FRANCISCA CHRISTY ROSANA

DPR Threatens to Not Hold Another Meeting with BPJS Health and Ministry of Health
Nov 6 2019, 12:09 AM by Francisca Christy Rosana, Kodrat Setiawan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Member of the House of Representatives Commission IX from the National Awakening Party (PKB) Faction, Nihayatul Wafiroh, complained about the issuance of Presidential Regulation No. 75 of 2019 concerning Health Insurance. The decree, signed by President Joko Widodo or Jokowi, endorsed the government's plan to increase BPJS Health premiums in all participant segments.
Nihayatul said the issuance of the Perpres deviated from the results of the hearing with the legislature. Previously, at a meeting on 2 September, all members of Commission IX agreed to ask the government not to raise BPJS Health premiums specifically for class III independent participants.
"I feel that this Commission IX has no more value. The results of the meeting last September, we asked the government not to increase fees for class III, but it turns out that the Presidential Regulation will still be published, "said Nihayatul in the Senayan complex, Jakarta, Wednesday, November 6, 2019.
Nihayatul said the government's efforts to hoist health insurance premiums, especially for class III, were still reaping the debate. Moreover, in accordance with the Perpres, the amount of contributions in all segments rose 100 percent from the original amount.
He then threatened his commission would not hold another meeting with BPJS Health and the Ministry of Health such as the government not to revoke the Perpres. "Do you agree, ladies and gentlemen?" Said Nihayatul asking for agreement from members of Commission IX after making threats.
The question was answered simultaneously by commission members. "Agree," said the majority of DPR members. However, the chair of the session has not yet knocked out the request of the members of the session because the authority to authorize the increase in fees is in the hands of President Jokowi.
As of this writing, the hearing was still ongoing. The Ministry of Health and BPJS Health have not yet responded to the statements of members of the House of Representatives Commission IX.
Based on Tempo's notes, at the meeting on September 2, the DPR asked the government to first improve data on health insurance contribution participants through data cleansing before raising premiums. Because, the Parliament indicated that many poor people were still paying premiums independently.
On the contrary, not all participants of contribution assistance are poor people. The DPR also asked the government to fix JKN aid recipient data in accordance with the audit results from the 2018 Financial and Development Supervisory Agency. At that time there were still 10,654,539 JKN participants with problems.
On the other hand, the Ministry of Social Affairs noted that it had deactivated 5 million JKN beneficiaries during August which were not registered in the integrated data. A total of 5 million beneficiaries have a valid population registration number and have never accessed health facilities.

FRANCISCA CHRISTY ROSANA
